com.alien.rfid

Class RFIDReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.alien.rfid.RFIDReader

  • public abstract class RFIDReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class RFIDReader. This is a base class for Alien RFID readers. Specific hardware models will each be a subclass of RFIDReader.

      • getInfo

        public abstract java.lang.String getInfo(RFIDInfo type)
        Get information about the Reader, such as model, RFID hardware and firmware versions.
        Returns:
        a string containing the information, or null if the information is not available

      • getInfo

        public java.util.Map<RFIDInfo,java.lang.String> getInfo()
        Get all information about the Reader, RFID hardware and firmware versions.
        Returns:
        a Map containing the information

      • getPower

        public abstract int getPower()
                      throws ReaderException
        Get RFID transmit power.
        Returns:
        transmit power in dBm
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is in the middle of a continuous inventory

      • setPower

        public abstract void setPower(int power)
                       throws ReaderException
        Set RFID transmit power.
        Parameters:
        power - RFID transmitting power in dBm
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)
        InvalidParamException - if the power value is not valid

      • setQ

        public abstract void setQ(int QValue)
                   throws ReaderException
        Set the starting Q parameter value that is used in the Gen2 protocol to read tags. The Q value indicates approximately how many tags to expect (2^Q).
        Parameters:
        QValue - the starting Q parameter value (0-15)
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)
        InvalidParamException - if the QValue is not valid

      • getQ

        public abstract int getQ()
                  throws ReaderException
        Get starting Q parameter value that is used in the Gen2 protocol to read tags. The Q value indicates approximately how many tags to expect (2^Q).
        Returns:
        current value of the Q parameter
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • getSession

        public abstract Session getSession()
                            throws ReaderException
        Get Gen2 session.
        Returns:
        the current Session parameter
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

        Parameters:

      • setMask

        public void setMask(Mask mask)
        Set the default global mask. This mask is applied during tag operations for methods that don't pass an explicit mask parameter.
        Parameters:
        mask - the new default Gen2 protocol mask

      • getMask

        public Mask getMask()
        Get the default global mask. This mask is applied during tag operations for methods that don't pass an explicit mask parameter. The initial default mask value is NONE.
        Returns:
        the default Gen2 protocol mask

      • setAccessPwd

        public void setAccessPwd(java.lang.String accessPwd)
        Set the default global access password. This access password is applied during tag operations for methods that don't pass an explicit access password parameter.
        Parameters:
        accessPwd - the new default access password

      • getAccessPwd

        public java.lang.String getAccessPwd()
        Get the default global access password. This access password is applied during tag operations for methods that don't pass an explicit access password parameter.
        Returns:
        the default access password

      • read

        public abstract RFIDResult read(Mask mask)
                         throws ReaderException
        Read a single RFID tag. This method runs synchronously, and returns the tag object within the RFIDResult.
        Parameters:
        mask - the Gen2 protocol mask. The reader will apply this mask to match only specific tags. To disable tag masking use Mask.NONE
        Returns:
        On success, RFIDResult.isSuccess() will return true and RFIDResult.getData() will return the Tag object.
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • read

        public RFIDResult read()
                throws ReaderException
        This method is the same as read(Mask), but uses the default mask (set by setMask(Mask)).
        Returns:
        On success, RFIDResult.isSuccess() will return true and RFIDResult.getData() will return the Tag object.
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • inventory

        public abstract void inventory(RFIDCallback callback,
             Mask mask)
                        throws ReaderException
        Start a continuous inventory. This runs as an asynchronous thread. Call isRunning() to check if the continue inventory is running. Call stop() to stop the continuous inventory thread.

        NOTE: The reader cannot respond to other commands during a continuous inventory. It is necessary to stop the continuous inventory using stop() before running other commands. If another command is sent while a continuous inventory is running, an RFIDBusyException is raised for that command.

        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to use for retrieving tag information
        mask - The Gen2 protocol mask. The reader will apply this mask to match only specific tags. To disable tag masking use Mask.NONE
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • inventory

        public void inventory(RFIDCallback callback)
               throws ReaderException
        This is the same as inventory(RFIDCallback, Mask), but uses the default mask (set by setMask(Mask)).
        Parameters:
        callback - The tag information is retrieved via this callback
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • stop

        public abstract void stop()
                   throws ReaderException
        Stop the currently-running continuous inventory.
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is error

      • isRunning

        public abstract boolean isRunning()
        Check if a continuous inventory is currently running.
        Returns:
        true if continuous inventory is running

      • kill

        public abstract RFIDResult kill(java.lang.String killPassword,
              Mask mask)
                         throws ReaderException
        Kill the RFID tag. This prevents the tag from communicating further using RFID. Once a tag is killed, it cannot be recovered.
        Parameters:
        killPassword - kill password (must be non-zero)
        mask - the Gen2 protocol mask. The reader will apply this mask to match only specific tags. To disable tag masking use Mask.NONE
        Returns:
        RFIDResult.isSuccess() will return true if the tag was killed
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • kill

        public RFIDResult kill(java.lang.String killPassword)
                throws ReaderException
        This method is the same as kill(String, Mask), but uses the default mask set by setMask(Mask)).
        Parameters:
        killPassword - kill password (must be non-zero)
        Returns:
        RFIDResult.isSuccess() will return true if the tag was killed
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • read

        public abstract RFIDResult read(Bank bank,
              int wordPointer,
              int wordCount,
              Mask mask,
              java.lang.String accessPassword)
                         throws ReaderException
        Reads data from a specific memory location of a tag. The pointer, and count values are all in word units.
        Parameters:
        bank - the Gen2 memory bank to read from
        wordPointer - pointer (in word units) to the memory location within the bank
        wordCount - the number of words to read
        mask - the Gen2 protocol mask. The reader will apply this mask to match only specific tags. To disable tag masking use Mask.NONE
        accessPassword - The access password used when accessing protected tag memory
        Returns:
        On success, RFIDResult.isSuccess() will return true and RFIDResult.getData() will contain the data.
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • read

        public RFIDResult read(Bank bank,
              int wordPointer,
              int wordCount,
              Mask mask)
                throws ReaderException
        This method is same as read(Bank, int, int, Mask, String), but uses the default access password (set by setAccessPwd(String)). The pointer, and count values are all in word units.
        Parameters:
        bank - the Gen2 memory bank to read from
        wordPointer - pointer (in word units) to the memory location within the bank
        wordCount - the number of words to read
        mask - the Gen2 protocol mask. The reader will apply this mask to match only specific tags. To disable tag masking use Mask.NONE
        Returns:
        On success, RFIDResult.isSuccess() will return true and RFIDResult.getData() will contain the data.
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • read

        public RFIDResult read(Bank bank,
              int wordPointer,
              int wordCount,
              java.lang.String accessPassword)
                throws ReaderException
        This method is the same as read(Bank, int, int, Mask, String), but uses the default mask (set by setMask(Mask)). The pointer, and count values are all in word units.
        Parameters:
        bank - the Gen2 memory bank to read from
        wordPointer - pointer (in word units) to the memory location within the bank
        wordCount - the number of words to read
        accessPassword - The access password used when accessing protected tag memory
        Returns:
        On success, RFIDResult.isSuccess() will return true and RFIDResult.getData() will contain the data.
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • read

        public RFIDResult read(Bank bank,
              int wordPointer,
              int wordCount)
                throws ReaderException
        This method is the same as read(Bank, int, int, Mask, String), but uses the default mask (set by setMask(Mask)) and the default access password (set by setAccessPwd(String)). The pointer, and count values are all in word units.
        Parameters:
        bank - the Gen2 memory bank to read from
        wordPointer - pointer (in word units) to the memory location within the bank
        wordCount - the number of words to read
        Returns:
        On success, RFIDResult.isSuccess() will return true and RFIDResult.getData() will contain the data.
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • write

        public abstract RFIDResult write(Bank bank,
               int wordPointer,
               java.lang.String data,
               Mask mask,
               java.lang.String accessPassword)
                          throws ReaderException
        Writes the given data into a specific bank at a specific word offset within a tag's memory. The pointer value is in word units.
        Parameters:
        bank - the Gen2 memory bank to write to
        wordPointer - pointer (in word units) to the memory location within the bank
        data - data to be written (in word units)
        mask - the Gen2 protocol mask. The reader will apply this mask to match only specific tags. To disable tag masking use Mask.NONE
        accessPassword - The access password used when accessing protected tag memory
        Returns:
        RFIDResult.isSuccess() will return true if the data was successfully written to the tag
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • write

        public RFIDResult write(Bank bank,
               int wordPointer,
               java.lang.String data,
               Mask mask)
                 throws ReaderException
        This method is the same as write(Bank, int, String, Mask, String), but uses the default access password (set by setAccessPwd(String)). The pointer value is in word units.
        Parameters:
        bank - the Gen2 memory bank to write to
        wordPointer - pointer (in word units) to the memory location within the bank
        data - data to be written (in word units)
        mask - the Gen2 protocol mask. The reader will apply this mask to match only specific tags. To disable tag masking use Mask.NONE
        Returns:
        RFIDResult.isSuccess() will return true if the data was successfully written to the tag
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • write

        public RFIDResult write(Bank bank,
               int wordPointer,
               java.lang.String data,
               java.lang.String accessPassword)
                 throws ReaderException
        This method is the same as write(Bank, int, String, Mask, String), but uses the default mask (set by setMask(Mask)). The pointer value is in word units.
        Parameters:
        bank - the Gen2 memory bank to write to
        wordPointer - pointer (in word units) to the memory location within the bank
        data - data to be written (in word units)
        accessPassword - access password to be used when accessing protected tag memory
        Returns:
        RFIDResult.isSuccess() will return true if the data was successfully written to the tag
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • write

        public RFIDResult write(Bank bank,
               int wordPointer,
               java.lang.String data)
                 throws ReaderException
        This method is the same as write(Bank, int, String, Mask, String), but uses the default mask (set by setMask(Mask)) and default access password (set by setAccessPwd(String)). The pointer value is in word units.
        Parameters:
        bank - the Gen2 memory bank to write to
        wordPointer - pointer (in word units) to the memory location within the bank
        data - data to be written
        Returns:
        RFIDResult.isSuccess() will return true if the data was successfully written to the tag
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • lock

        public abstract RFIDResult lock(LockFields fields,
              LockType lockType,
              Mask mask,
              java.lang.String accessPassword)
                         throws ReaderException
        Lock, Unlock, PermaLock, or PermaUnlock tag's memory fields. If the EPC or USER memory fields are locked, they become read-only. If the AccessPassword or KillPassword fields are locked, they not accessible without knowing the access password.
        Parameters:
        fields - a bitmap of memory fields to be locked. Multiple memory fields can be specified using the '|' operation.
        lockType - the type of lock operation to be performed
        mask - the Gen2 protocol mask. The reader will apply this mask to match only specific tags. To disable tag masking use Mask.NONE
        accessPassword - the access password to be used when accessing protected tag memory
        Returns:
        RFIDResult.isSuccess() will return true if the lock operation was successful
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • lock

        public RFIDResult lock(LockFields fields,
              LockType lockType,
              Mask mask)
                throws ReaderException
        This method is the same as lock(LockFields, LockType, Mask, String), but uses the default access password (set by setAccessPwd(String)).
        Parameters:
        fields - a bitmap of memory fields to lock. Multiple memory fields can be specified using the '|' operation.
        lockType - the type of lock operation to be performed
        mask - the Gen2 protocol mask. The reader will apply this mask to match only specific tags. To disable tag masking use Mask.NONE
        Returns:
        RFIDResult.isSuccess() will return true if the lock operation was successful
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • lock

        public RFIDResult lock(LockFields fields,
              LockType lockType,
              java.lang.String accessPassword)
                throws ReaderException
        This method is the same as lock(LockFields, LockType, Mask, String), but uses the default mask (set by setMask(Mask)).
        Parameters:
        fields - a bitmap of memory fields to lock. Multiple memory fields can be specified using the '|' operation.
        lockType - the type of lock operation to be performed
        accessPassword - the access password to be used when accessing protected tag memory
        Returns:
        RFIDResult.isSuccess() will return true if the lock operation was successful
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)

      • lock

        public RFIDResult lock(LockFields fields,
              LockType lockType)
                throws ReaderException
        This method is the same as lock(LockFields, LockType, Mask, String), but uses the default mask (set by setMask(Mask)) and default access password (set by setAccessPwd(String)).
        Parameters:
        fields - a bitmap of memory fields to lock. Multiple memory fields can be specified using the '|' operation.
        lockType - the type of lock operation to be performed
        Returns:
        RFIDResult.isSuccess() will return true if the lock operation was successful
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error
        RFIDBusyException - if the reader is busy (e.g. performing a continuous inventory)
